reviews_data.review_text: beautiful place!!! great coffee & drinks. you can host special events here as well
Super cozy wine bar with great coffee too! Trivia on certain nights too!
Convenient
A wonderland, truly!

The gardens themselves are beautiful! Atmosphere is is lovely.  However, having an event here is not the easiest. I was not the one who was hosting, but my friend was. I helped her set everything up & brought everything in prior to guests arriving. When we got there the seats were dirty, they looked like they had mildew all over them. I asked if they could be wiped down and the manager Jason (I think) yelled to someone on staff "Hey! Can you wipe the seats down again, apparently they're still dirty even though we already wiped them down" I defended my ask by saying they looked like they were outside when it rained & I was able to flick dried whatever it was off of the chairs. I was also told they were stored inside- wrongo- they are stored in their outside storage pod- so yes, outside so they were mildewy.  Jason proceeded to tell me that they had them professionally assessed & they can't be cleaned anymore they are permanently  like that. Which tells me, they are permanently dirty.  Then the catering arrived- which was some Publix deli looking sandwiches with no name cards so everyone had to guess what was in each sandwich. There was no cutlery, regular sized plates or the basic condiments that go with sandwiches. Then the wine that was previously selected for the menu was changed but no one informed the host. She found out by going to the bar to order wine & realized what she selected with the venue was not available so the event manager changed it to a wine that the host specifically asked to NOT have out.  The venue did not provide heating lamps, without a cost, although is a venue that is mostly outside. There was little to no light in the actual event space, the string lights & t-light candles can only do so much. The trash cans were full of trash from the last event, so we had to ask for them to be cleaned out.  As someone who works in the event & hospitality industry professionally, I might be a little picky. But my friend spent $750 + the required F&B min (which was over $1,000) on an experience that was not worth more than $500.  Was honestly disappointed on how a venue that hosts small scaled events regularly presented themselves so rudely & obviously disorganized. Which is a shame because the venue space is lovely- its everything else surrounding that made the experience not pleasant.
Love everything about this place and it's completely free!!!
Love the little wine shop they have, all while being able to enjoy their garden to hangout!
Was here for a wedding great venue and environment, smallish parking area but it's near uptown so to be expected

Rosie's Wine Garden is one the best spots in Charlotte. Beautiful gardens that are more expansive than you would expect, it's nice to wander and discover new little pockets to sit. They have a good selection of wine and their service is always quick. We take everyone who visits us in Charlotte here as it truly is a gem.
Beautiful garden with wine. Bring in your own food and enjoy!

This place is everything. The ladies behind the bar are super friendly and helpful, there is a wide variety of drinks for ALL of your friends I had a strawberry rhubarb sour that was amazing and as I left I grabbed the seasonal Chai and apple cider blend that was absolutely top notch. On top of all of that the gardens are absolutely gorgeous. We got lucky and it was rainy today so it was almost completely empty and it was magical. I can't wait to go back!
Great spot for a date, girls night, or just chilling. Fire pits are super nice now that it's getting chillier. Half-priced bottled on Wednesday are excellent.
Loved it

Carol, the associate who assisted us, did a FANTASTIC job!!  She brought out 2 wines that matched my requested style AND a 3rd bonus suggestion that was very, very good!! We were able to sample all 3 wines before deciding..  They also had vegan brownies and cookies!  The prices were quite reasonable too.
Beautiful setting! You should come by for a sit 😎🍷
Really nice and very unique place! We will be back, though we liv e 40 miles away!

Absolutely beautiful at night, especially during spring or fall! Great place to go for a really cute date or just a good time together. Plenty of seating in brightly lit areas, as well as cozy romantic corners as well. If you're going on the weekend, I highly recommend calling ahead to make sure it isn't closed for a private event.

Absolutely lovely! The garden is spacious and so pretty, with great bottles of wine and an adorable atmosphere. I loved that bug spray was offered upon walking outside because it is a garden, so definitely buggy! For that, I recommend wearing long pants or a dress to cover the legs. I had no problems and had a long jumpsuit on.
Such a beautiful place
What a great last-minute find! Asked Google where to go in Noda and found this place. Hidden gem!
Our family loves the coffee shop and garden for our lazy Sunday's. All staff we have met are very friendly and helpful with any questions we have. They also carry a good selection of local beer.
Cutest place to get coffee or wine and enjoy the beautiful garden!
I love this place .
Really cute garden and shop. Would be amazing during peak blooming season. Had a glass of cava and strolled around with a friend. Would be a great date night spot as well!
Great little spot. Coffee, wine, beer and lots of spots to sit and chat with friends in the garden.

Really enjoyed a visit to Rosie's with coworkers! It's the perfect place to split a bottle (or two) of wine or have a glass while you read a book or write. There was an event happening while I was there so individuals/organizations are able to rent space. Additionally, the staff was super helpful with picking out a wine that aligns with your tastebuds and the season!
Ecpensive! Nice spot. $10 for glass of house red wine. Yikes! Nice location. Atmosphere. Clean bathroom. Outside area very cool.

Visited at twilight after dinner. We found a beautiful, romantic place with winding paths around a garden strung with lights. There are a variety of places to sit, from picnic tables and garden benches to reclining chairs and patio setups. The limited indoor seating is equally colorful and comfortable if the outdoors isn't your style. Nice hideaway in the middle of downtown Charlotte—highly recommend!
We walked in and not a single employee was to be found. We called around the shop and no one ever came. I can't believe that a business would leave their shop unattended like this.
Iced Teas are excellent and the garden is peaceful and magical...and a great place for fiti ops.
Amazing spot! Live music on Thursdays too.

Was there for tea party had a wonderful morning fellowship and support for staff was AWESOME,  first time in Charlotte at a event that clam my mind and was relaxing in my 22 years of being here. THANK YOU FOR THE EXPERIENCE.

The daily specials and events are so fun! It's a great place to have a girls night, grab a coffee and take a walk through the pathways, buy a few plants, smell the roses. One of my favs places to take friends visiting from out of town.
This place is magical. Great little wine bar hidden away close to downtown Charlotte. Phillip was the best at suggesting wine for us.
This is a great place to spend some time in nature with a nice beverage. The staff was extremely helpful by guiding me to a wine I really enjoyed.

This hidden garden was a nice peaceful respite from the bumbling of the city. Walking in and taking in the smells of the flowers was an idyllic setting for sipping on a nicely crafted cortado.  Rosie's combined a few of my favorite things, hidden gardens, shots of espresso, and an artistic yet homely vibe to set up what turned into a wonderful morning.  I'll most assuredly be back any time I find myself in Charlotte again.
Cuuuuute! Outdoor seating is divine. Sculptures and quiet/private space, I love it. Bring bug spray!
Great relaxing venue

Lost in the garden of versus and other things. As soon as you walk in the lush garden the sculptures, the symphony of birds, and wildlife just engulfed me.  So many different places to get lost in. There is also a shop to buy drinks, plants, and things.  A must see in Charlotte for sure.
A beautiful venue that's tucked away in NODA. Te'jani played live and really added to the evening. Really talented musician.
My go to date spot or Tuesday trivia
Will surpasd your expectations.
One of my newfound favorite coffeeshops in Charlotte. The garden area might be the best workspace in the whole city!

Such a peaceful place full of good vibes! 😍 wine is good and great for sharing. I recommend going to optimist hall and parking there, getting some food to go then walking to Rosie's! They allow outside food. Get a bottle from them, head out to the garden and voila, you got a perfect set up!
Super cute. Great place to take pictures. They even have an area you can buy plants.
Great coffee with a beautiful garden! What more can you ask!!
Been twice and wine selection isn't great. I also like sweet wines and they had ONE to choose from. Limited snacks and they're expensive. Grounds are pretty though.

You will not find any place like this one in the city. A coffee and wine Cafe with an entire block's worth of a sculpted garden a to dine in and walk through. Divine is not a good enough word to describe the experience.
Beautifully serene and super cool for socializing casually or more formally.

Beautiful garden and atmosphere. We went in the morning for coffee but can only imagine how beautiful the garden is at night with all of the lights. Barista was very friendly and seemed knowledgeable.
Very nice vibe
We love Rosie's! The coffee and wine is great. Love this atmosphere. Whenever we have out of town family we always bring them and they love this spot!
Boyfriend and I loved it.. . Romantic, chill, beautiful ❤️

I was recommended Rosie's as a place to get out of the house to work as I WFH full-time. My friend and I met up on a Friday to work a half day and it was absolutely perfect. The shop was lively, but quiet enough to work, and after work, we sat in the stunning gardens and had a bottle of wine. It looks like they also host a yoga session on Friday mornings which I will absolutely be back to try. Our barista was also very sweet. I highly recommend visiting on a beautiful, sunny day and enjoying what the gardens have to offer.
Tranquil with indoor and outdoor seating

Honestly my favorite place in Charlotte! They have a well curated wine list. The employees are very friendly and are knowledgeable of their selection and offerings. They have coffee and tea on top of the wine. They also leave the loose leaf tea bag in the cup so you can refill for free, which is a huge plus. The garden is cute and quaint.
It could use a bit of spring cleaning but it's a cute spot.
Great place and the park takes it to a whole other level

This place is a gem, the coffee is fantastic with milk from happy cows if you so desire.  Knowledgeable and friendly staff on wine selection as well.  Inside is quaint and cute, suitable to work from a laptop at as they have free wifi as well.  But you should really go sit outside, it's a beautiful setting among rose gardens with tables and benches setup throughout.  Games are available, and feel free to bring your own food or munchies.  Live music on Thursdays.  I kind of hate telling people, this is such a great place I want it all to myself but it should be enjoyed by all.  Go soon, go often.
Great outdoor area with lights and fire pits. Great choices of wine

A night out with #QuantumDionysus my tribe my crew... at first I was not truly interested bc parking is horrible... it's very limited and directions for folks unfamiliar with the area suck for the overflow parking at the Cats garage.  Other than that... I L.O.V.E thiiis space.  The garden is perfect for date night/ girls night or quiet solo time.  The iced decaf coffee was delicious.  The wine options are great. They had live music which we danced to around the firepit. We ordered pizza to be delivered and I bought a S'mores Kit!!!! Omg the best s'mores I've ever had. Thre energy was cool.  Everyone was helpful.  My sisters and I got to love on each other with affirmations and such.  It was a perfect space for healing and positive vibes ! And I drank edible glitter!!!
Enchanting
Beautiful space and friendly staff!
I had really great coffee here, and the grounds are nice.
Overpriced, paying for the garden. Order hot cider, he took it right out of the jug. Tea was terrible too.
Lovely coffee shop with friendly/helpful baristas. Walking inside feels like a warm hug. Walking outside to gorgeous gardens accompanies a tasty beverage perfectly.

One of the cutest spots in town! There's a nice selection of wines that you can buy by the glass or the bottle, or you can get a fresh cup of coffee. Then take your beverage outside and enjoy the stunning gardens!!
Amazing place , I'd love to visit it again whenever I'm in South Carolina

Today was my first time visiting Rosie's and I'll have to say, I'll definitely be back! The atmosphere was so eclectic and unique. I wish I'd been able to visit in the spring or summer so it could have been nicer outside but it wasn't too cold to enjoy the gardens. I went for coffee but they have a huge selection of beverages. I was meeting a relocation client there, who is moving from New Jersey, and it was so easy to chat about her real estate needs. I would recommend Rosie's to anyone looking for somewhere to grab a coffee while enjoying a great atmosphere.
Beautiful spot for a date or drink.  They have wine, beer, coffee.  Plenty of seating all around the garden and can find a more secluded area.
I loved it i definitely recommend it
An idyllic spot to consume caffeine, wine, and conversation. The garden was beautiful and the wine selection pleasing. Bring a book and enjoy!

This was such a pretty place. What a great little spot to meet up with a group of people and drink some wine and bring your own snacks. They had an event there today called the boozy brunch and it was really fun.
Very cute place to relax in the evening, great trivia

This venue is nice. However, I live across the street & I wake up for work at 5 AM. The music is so loud it protrudes into my apartment. There is no consideration. On the website it reflects it should be closed on a Sunday at 8 am. It is 9:28PM and the music is still going. We all love to have fun but can you lower the music for the residential living right next to you? I'm filing a complaint with the city. This is a nightmare ordeal.

Gorgeous garden with plenty of outdoor space for larger groups and smaller tables for couples.  You can grab a glass of wine, beer or a coffee but they've also got plenty of wine by the bottle options as well.  They typically have heaters in the winter so it's even a great place on a cooler evening.  It is a fun place to explore and the laid back vibe makes it a great space for dates or catching up with friends.
Hidden Gem. Gorgeous gardens with a very relaxing feel. I could have stayed for hours.
Beautiful! Good wine and good times
Beautiful outdoor seating and fun trivia night

Stumbled upon this place one late Friday night. Possibly the most ethereal, magical place I've ever been to!! Good selection of wines. I want to come back for their coffee sometime. The staff was super cool too. Lots of seating options outside, good music, great vibes. The garden at night was so beautiful, like a pretty summer garden party. 12/10 🪄
Awesome place, beautiful garden area with plenty of plants and cool seating areas! The coffee is pretty good as well!
Their coffee is OK. The garden is lovely with plenty of room to social distance.

We had our first visit here today. This spot has a cool vibe. My wife and i chose the Vinabade Albariño, a delightful Spanish white wine with deep stone fruit aromas, and just the right acidity. We enjoyed our wine in a beautiful garden setting. This spot is a must for your wine experience in NODA. They offer an affordable, yet dynamic wine list, filled with all kinds of goodies! Thank you Dan and staff for a 5 star experience. We will be back! ✌️❤️🍷
Great place to sip wine! Very eclectic selection by the glass and a huge shady garden to sit and sip. Staff is very knowledgeable and friendly.
Beautiful garden. Nice selection of wines. Good coffee. I'll definitely be back.
Family place and good for make a picnic!!
What a wonderful environment for downtown. This will become a usual spot for us!
Beautiful rose garden in downtown Charlotte with Wine and Coffee!
Beautiful space in the garden to drink wine. Just lovely. Go there.
Super cute garden, plus live music, and great wine, coffee, and tea options. What's not to love?

Beautiful garden space, with quite the eclectic (in a good way) mix of flowers, plants trees lights and a old train car. It's all laid out nicely so you can feel like you have your own space to sit and talk, even if there are people just a few feet away. after we ordered se coffee, my wife and I with our dog enjoyed strolling throughout and seeing the different part of the garden as we sipped. Both of our coffees(and iced latte and iced chai) were  heavy on the milk, and we probably wouldn't order again, but the ambiance of the garden more than made up for that. We will probably be back in the evening for a glass of wine instead, as it seems the perfect place to relax after a workday.
Great chill found here!
Lovely spot to relax and grab a drink.
Barista was very friendly today, and made a delicious latte. Had a wonderful time walking in the garden while enjoying my coffee with a friend.
I cannot wait to return.  What's better than enjoying a glass of wine in a beautiful garden?
(Translated by Google) nice place for a conversation and a coffee  (Original) lindo sitio para una conversación y un café
Could this be? Perhaps Charlotte's best kept secret
Hidden gem!
What a lovely hidden gem. The garden is absolutely beautiful. It is lovely to stroll around with a delicious glass of wine. The owners are very nice. We had a great experience here.

This place has a great atmosphere!  Good wine selection and a great place to hang out and talk.  I suggest you skip the small parking lot in the evening and go straight to the cats parking structure behind the building.  Just take McGill from Davidson st, it's across from the park and a short walk.
Perfect for any gathering. The only serve drinks but you can bring your own food!!
Very delightful place. The barista was great. Unfortunately the garden wasn't in bloom. Still a nice garden spot to enjoy some peace and nature with a hot cup of Chai tea.

Rosie's is the best little gem in Charlotte. The wine selection is great. The gardens are beautiful and secluded. The staff is always friendly and attentive. Kelvin, in particular, has been so damn personable that you feel like you stepped into a good friend's backyard. That's why we prefer the Rosie's atmosphere over any other bar/cafe/outdoor setting in Charlotte. They're also great with Covid precautions and you can feel safe enjoying your wine or coffee in a place where staff have taken measures to limit risk.
Great coffee and amazing out door seating!
Always a wonderful environment to sit and enjoy friends.
Great coffee selection! Beautiful environment with friendly community. One of my all time favorite places in Charlotte.

This lovely little slice of heaven is just outside uptown! Attracts a LOT of people, but we were still able to have a good socially distanced time together.  On a side note, it was wonderful to smell the boxwood bushes. Reminds me of colonial gardens!
The territory is wow ! Coffee is ok. I like the atmosphere 😍😍
So cozy! Great wine!

This place is a hidden gem in the Charlotte area. Great wine and coffee. This place is amazing and wonderful place to relax. Awesome garden to hang and take a relaxing break from the city. If you are need for a secret garden, this is the place!!
What a cool place, with the rose gardens outside (The McGill Rose Garden) a great place to be outside, chill and enjoy their wine/coffee! Beautiful hidden gem right outside uptown I-277 loop!!
Adorable coffee and wine shop. Get a glass or bottle and sit amongst the flowers. They have coffee, wine and beer.
We can't wait to visit in the spring and summer! Staff is welcoming and the garden is gorgeous at night.

Went to Rosie's for a drink before my birthday dinner. It was cold outside, but there were heaters and fire pits to keep us warm. The atmosphere was lovely and COVID-friendly. Ordering was easy and the staff were kind and courteous. Definitely a new favorite spot.
Super cute place. The garden is beautiful at night. Can't wait to go back.
This place is amazing! So beautiful ❤️ it's a great place to hang out next to the fire surrounded by nature. ☘️

Loved this place and the concept. We came in on a Thursday and enjoyed their special $12 flight. I deff recommend the red ones, specially the Malbec. They set up the fire by our table and we enjoyed some dessert we had brought in. Staff members were attentive and welcoming. We had a chance to walk around a bit and would love to see this place in daylight too.
Beautiful... Dusk is the time to be here...
Great little spot adjacent to the park. Good selection of drinks that you can go sit by the fire or a heater outside and enjoy the night.

This place is a hidden gem! Such a quiet and calm atmosphere to enjoy some wine or a beer in a socially distant way. The garden itself is huge with plenty of hidden tables and artwork. The lights, fires, and heating lamps make it a perfect place to stay into the evening. They have a nice wine selection and incredibly helpful and kind staff!

Rosie's Wine Garden was previously only open for private parties, weddings and the like. If you want to go out to enjoy a glass or two of wine with friends or that special someone this place has excellent ambiance and a great variety of domestic and International wines.
Incredible atmosphere outside among the gardens with a nice glass of wine
A hidden gem. May it never change.

Terrible service. It's literally only wine and people, it should be easy. Not all tables were filled but ran out of glassware. During COVID, probably not the right time to re-pour into used glasses! Didn't even get a glass rinse out offered. Outdoor space is delightful and very secret garden-ish. Hopefully today was just an off day for staff, but really disappointed in our interaction.

Cutest little gem in the middle of downtown Charlotte. Was wanting to waste time before my flight later that night and popped up Rosie's garden. Perfect place to just enjoy a glass or a bottle of wine surrounded by nature. I found a little patch of grass to soak up the sun and relax before having to leave. I would definitely add. this place on my list of recommendation for locals and tourists to visit.
Very covid safe!! The garden is absolutely wonderful and spaced out. The red wine flight was delightful. Definitely will be back!!
Absolutely gorgeous place, great wine selection, and friendly staff. One of my favorite spots in CLT.
Where else can you have a glass (or bottle) of wine in a garden and keep social distance? Tired of your back yard, try Rosie's.

Quaint place with a lovely back area with plenty of vegetation and lots of color. The only reason it did not get a 5 star review is because as I am drinking the bottle of wine I purchased I realized there was multiple price stickers stacked on top of each other. The price I paid was $35 plus tax however the sticker underneath said $20. While there are plenty of legitimate reasons to increase the price, I feel as if I have been cheated on a certain degree and for that I am not coming back.  I had recently wrote this post before talking to the store manager, and I do feel as if I have left an unfair review. The price was recently marked up because they had changed from their retail prices they were selling to grocery stores to in store purchases which had just re-opened to being a store in which you can purchase wine onsite and consume it in a lovely garden behind the store which they own.
Rosie's is INCREDIBLE.  Great wine, great atmosphere.  What a wonderful place to spend an evening. Perfect date night/day spot.
Gorgeous environment and the wine prices were very reasonable. Will definitely visit again.
Fantastic venue for a bottle of wine on a beautiful summer night. Fun selection and great staff.

Gorgeous small hidden garden near uptown. Lots of luscious greenery and they even sell drinks here. I've been coming to this spot for the past few years to study during spring; and was worried that it would become crowded with the opening of the wine garden, but it still remains a quaint small friendly location!
One of the must-see places in Charlotte. Perfect spot for a relaxing afternoon or place to grab a few drinks with friends.
This place is wonderful! Great wine, great atmosphere, and an amazing place to meet old friends! Definitely split a bottle and walk through the garden!
What a little gem this place is. This is a charming and cozy place to have a glass of wine inside or outside in the garden.  The staff is helpful and unpretentious.
Awesome place to chill!
Loved this place and excellent service! Would definitely recommend

Rosie's Wine Garden is the perfect place to have a relaxing afternoon or evening with friends! The inside is quaint and eclectic, the wine is delicious and reasonably priced, and the gardens are stunning! A girlfriend and I headed there on a Friday night, and the live music, hanging lights and secrecy of the garden were magical. Even though the garden is located next to a busy N. Davidson road, you barely hear or notice anything outside of the garden! Highly recommend for date nights- both romantic and friendly!
The cutest, most beautiful place to get a drink, especially in the evening. They had live music when we went and it was absolutely perfect. They allow outside food so you can bring your own picnic!
Really cute place to grab a drink
